ICC member states seek to calm US concerns
subhead: Gathered for their annual assembly in The Hague, the 125 member states of the International Criminal Court opted not to confront Washington, which has threatened the Court's officials with sweeping sanctions unless the arrest warrant for Benjamin Netanyahu is withdrawn.

China announces new round of panda diplomacy with France
subhead: Xi Jinping gave his political approval on Thursday, during the visit of President Emmanuel Macron and his wife Brigitte, for new pandas to be sent to France.

title: France opts for discretion after drones spotted above naval base
subhead: While other European countries have chosen to politicize suspicious flyovers of strategic infrastructure, France has remained cautious about attributing responsibility for these intrusions.

title: 'Notre-Dame de Paris's triumph highlights the Church's uncharitable position in refusing to charge tourists'
subhead: Not charging the millions of visitors who flock to the Paris cathedral each year is incomprehensible when considering the dire state of public finances devoted to the conservation of France's religious heritage, writes Le Monde's Michel Guerrin in his column.

title: 2026 World Cup excites Atlanta's business community: 'A generational opportunity'
subhead: The capital of Georgia, which hosted the 1996 Olympic Games, is set to welcome eight matches during the upcoming World Cup. For local business leaders, the event is first and foremost an opportunity to do business.

Influential study on glyphosate safety retracted 25 years after publication
subhead: A 2000 study that concluded the well-known herbicide glyphosate was safe, widely cited since then, has just been officially disavowed by the journal that published it. The scientists are suspected of having signed a text actually prepared by Monsanto.

title: War in Ukraine: Europe finds itself sidelined and humiliated by the Trump administration
subhead: Steve Witkoff, the US president's special envoy, and Jared Kushner, Donald Trump's son-in-law, chose to meet the Ukrainian negotiators in Miami after canceling their Brussels stopover on their return from Moscow.
byline: Claire Gatinois,  Elsa Conesa and  Philippe Jacqué

title: Iran's independent cinema in full revolt: 'With Woman, Life, Freedom, a major barrier was broken'
subhead: Galvanized by the movement that emerged after the death of Mahsa Amini in September 2022, more and more filmmakers are dating to shoot outside any official framework. In a country where film production is a state matter, their films, made and distributed clandestinely, show Iranian society as it really is.
